text: hi everyone today I will character
flower dessert this dessert has this
beautiful name because it's not like a
little flower falling on a peaceful Lake
the ingredients are simple you just need
pierre mung beans we can be bought in a
package like this sugar tapioca starch
and water firstly we will wash half a
cup of mung beans wash it carefully and
drain and wash again a few times until
the water become clear
then soak it in water for at least one
hour after that we cook the mung beans
in a rice cooker the water level should
be just as high as the beans about half
a cup and cook it lightly cook rice when
the beans are cooked stir gently with
chopsticks
they should be soft but not broken if
you don't have a rice cooker you can
place them in a strainer and bring to
steam for about 15 minutes
next fear a medium saucepan with 1 liter
of water add 3/4 cup of sugar and stir
until the sugar dissolve then I have a
cup of your cast edge and stir until the
completely dissolved
then add a pinch of salt and cook under
high heat or I constantly whisking up
the tree to four minutes you will see
some cooks that start floating to the
surface now turn the heat to medium-low
and keep whisking for another three to
four minutes until the liquid become
thicker and turn translucent completely
like this is good turn off the hit then
gently stir in the cooked mung beans
add some vanilla or grapefruit aroma
extract or any other aroma extract that
you like finished you can serve this hot
or chilled simply like that or with some
coconut milk or shredded coconut
my favorite aroma for this dessert is
measuring skins which are slide into
very thin strips they are amazing flavor
to this dessert so you should try it out
that's it for today thank you very much
for watching and bye-bye
you
